pageContext.claim: “Just got recent Poll - much higher than President O at same time....Well, much more has been accomplished!”
pageContext.analysis: It's not clear which poll Trump is referring to. But he often tweets about Rasmussen, a right-leaning poll that consistently rates Trump higher than most other polls. Obama had a rating of 47 percent on April 27, 2010, whereas Trump was also at 47 percent on April 27. In the 538 poll average, Obama was at 48 percent and Trump at 40 percent at the end of April in their second year in office.
